methods.description: Determines the description for a given key. This function is called while formatting the output of a Field or FilterField control in case a description is to be displayed but only a key is given. If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned. As the key might change (uppercase), an object with key and description can be returned. If the description cannot be determined, a corresponding FormatException is thrown.

methods.name: getItemForValue

returnValue.description: Object containing description, key, in and out parameters. If it is not available right now (must be requested), a Promise is returned.

parameters.name: oConfig

parsedValue.description: Value parsed by data type to fit the data type of the key

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table the FieldHelp element might be connected to a different row.

checkKeyFirst.name: checkKeyFirst
checkKeyFirst.description: If set, it first should be checked if the value fits a key

checkKey.name: checkKey
checkKey.description: If set, it should be checked if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

checkDescription.name: checkDescription
checkDescription.description: If set, it should be checked if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

conditionModelName.name: conditionModelName
conditionModelName.description: Name of the ConditionModel, if bound to one

parameters.description: Configuration

throws.description: if item cannot be determined

methods.description:
Determines the key, description, and the in and out parameters of a user input. If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned. The result needs to be an object containing the following properties: description, key, and in and out parameters.
  • key: Key of the item
  • description: Description of the item
  • inParameters: Object with in parameters and the corresponding value
  • outParameters: Object with out parameters and the corresponding value
If the item cannot be determined, a corresponding ParseException is thrown.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate
symbols.description: Delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table} and ODataV4. Enables additional analytical capabilities.

methods.name: fetchPropertiesForBinding

returnValue.description: Once resolved, an array of PropertyInfo objects is returned

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description: Retrieves the relevant metadata that will be used for the table binding, and returns the PropertyInfo array. If it is not overridden, this method returns the same as fetchProperties. When overriding the method make sure the returned result is consistent with what is returned by fetchProperties.

methods.name: fetchPropertyExtensions

returnValue.description: Key-value map, where the key is the name of the property, and the value is the extension

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

parameters.name: aProperties
parameters.description: PropertyInfo

methods.description: Fetches the property extensions. Note: Property extensions add model-specific information. To ensure a clear separation from the standard property information, the extensions need to be passed separately to the constructor, together with their attribute metadata. An extension has to be provided as a key-value pair, where the key is the name of the property and the value is the extension of this property. It is not allowed to provide extensions without the corresponding attribute metadata.

methods.name: fetchPropertyExtensionsForBinding

returnValue.description: Key-value map, where the key is the name of the property, and the value is the extension

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

parameters.name: aProperties
parameters.description: PropertyInfo

methods.description: Fetches the property extensions that will be used for the table binding. If it is not overridden, this method returns the same as fetchPropertyExtensions. When overriding the method make sure the returned result is consistent with what is returned by fetchPropertyExtensions.

methods.name: getPropertyHelperClass

returnValue.description: The PropertyHelper class.

methods.description: Gets the model-specific PropertyHelper class to create an instance of.

methods.name: updateBinding

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

parameters.name: oBindingInfo
parameters.description: The binding info object to be used to bind the table to the model.

parameters.name: oBinding
parameters.description: The binding instance of the table

methods.description: Updates the row binding of the table if possible, rebinds otherwise. Compares the current and previous state of the table to detect whether rebinding is necessary or not. The diffing happens for the sorters, filters, aggregation, parameters, and the path of the binding. Other {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject.AggregationBindingInfo binding info} keys like events, model... must be provided in the {@link #updateBindingInfo updateBindingInfo} method always, and those keys must not be changed conditionally.

methods.description: Requests the content of the value help. This function is called when the value help is opened or a key or description is requested. So, depending on the value help content used, all content controls and data need to be assigned. Once they are assigned and the data is set, the returned Promise needs to be resolved. Only then does the value help continue opening or reading data.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc
symbols.description:
The SAPUI5 library that contains the metadata-driven controls and other entities.

SAP Internal This library is restricted to use by SAP internal projects only.

experimental.text: Disclaimer: Usage Restrictions: The components of this library are under development and documented as private. Their APIs are subject to change and should not be used in productive scenarios without further agreement. A general availability of sap.ui.mdc will be announced via the usual channels.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar
symbols.description: The column for the metadata driven table, that hold the template to be shown when the rows has data.

properties.name: useAsHeader
properties.description: Determines whether the toolbar is used as header (e.g. for a table).

aggregations.name: begin
aggregations.description: Content shown at the begin of the toolbar (e.g. Title).

aggregations.name: between
aggregations.description: Content shown between the title and actions on the toolbar.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description: Further actions in the toolbar.

aggregations.name: end
aggregations.description: Content at the end of the toolbar.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description:
Constructor for a new ActionToolbar.
Note:
The control is experimental and the API / behavior is not finalized. It should only be used internally in other mdc controls (e.g. chart/table).
The content aggregation of the control must not be used. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Chart
symbols.description: The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the chart.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defines the height of the chart.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in chart

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Defines the no data text shown in the chart.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Specifies the personalization options available for the chart.
Note: The order of the provided options does not influence the arrangement of the icons on the UI.

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description: Enables the legend of the chart.

properties.name: ignoreToolbarActions
properties.description: Specifies which actions should not be available in the chart's toolbar.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: The minimal width

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: The minimal height

properties.name: sortConditions
properties.description: Defines the sort conditions. Note: This property is exclusively used for handling flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description: Defines the filter conditions. Note: This property is exclusively used for handling flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

properties.name: showChartTooltip
properties.description: Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip. If set to true, an instance of {@link sap.viz.ui5.controls.VizTooltip} is created and shown when hovering over a data point.

properties.name: autoBindOnInit
properties.description: If set to true, the chart is automatically bound after initialization. If set to false, the chart is bound after the first call to rebind.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart to be created by the Chart control.

properties.name: showSelectionDetails
properties.description: Enables the Details button in the chart toolbar.

properties.name: propertyInfo
properties.description:
Specifies the chart metadata.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility/ Fiori Elements. Do not use it otherwise.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: This property describes the measures and dimensions visible in the chart. Changes in the personalization are also reflected here.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description: This aggregation describes actions that are added to the chart toolbar. See {@link sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAction} for more information.

aggregations.name: variant
aggregations.description: Reference to a {@link sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement} control for the chart.

associations.name: filter
associations.description: Control or object that enables the chart to do filtering, such as {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar}. Also see {@link sap.ui.mdc.IFilter}.

events.name: selectionDetailsActionPressed
events.description: This event is fired when a SelectionDetailsAction is pressed.

action.name: action
action.description: The action that has to be processed once the action has been pressed

itemContexts.name: itemContexts
itemContexts.description: If the action is pressed on one of the {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem items}, the parameter contains the {@link sap.ui.model.Context context} of the pressed {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem item}. If a custom action or action group of the SelectionDetails popover is pressed, this parameter contains all {@link sap.ui.model.Context contexts} of the {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem items}.

level.name: level
level.description: The action level of action buttons. The available levels are Item, List and Group

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator
symbols.description: Creates an sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator object. This is used in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control to define which filter operators are supported. If a function or property is initial, the default implementation is used.

parameters.name: oConfiguration

name.name: name
name.description: Name of the operator used in the condition

alias.name: alias
alias.description: Alias names based on BaseType, used to map to DynamicDateOption if DynamicDateRange is used

filterOperator.name: filterOperator
filterOperator.description: The operator's default filter operator that is created as defined in {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator FilterOperator}

tokenParse.name: tokenParse
tokenParse.description: The string representation of the regular expression that is used by the operator to parse a value to eliminate the operator and get the data string. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

tokenFormat.name: tokenFormat
tokenFormat.description: The string representation that is used by the operator to format a value into an output string. For the value placeholder {0} and {1} are used. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

valueTypes.name: valueTypes
valueTypes.description:
Array of type to be used. The length of the array defines the number of values that need to be entered with the operator.
If set to Operator.ValueType.Self the Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.
If set to Operator.ValueType.SelfNoParse same as Operator.ValueType.Self, except that the input value parsing will not be called.
If set to Operator.ValueType.Static a simple string type is used to display static text.
If set to a name of a data type an instance of this data type will be used.
If set to an object with the properties name, formatOptions and constraints an instance of the corresponding data type will be used. The type given via name must be required by the application.

longText.name: longText
longText.description:
String representation of the operator as a long text.
If longText is not given , it is looked up in the resource bundle of the sap.ui.mdc library by the key operators.{oConfiguration.name}.longText

tokenText.name: tokenText
tokenText.description:
String representation of the operator as a short text.
If the token text is not given, it is looked up in the resource bundle of the sap.ui.mdc library by the key operators.{oConfiguration.name}.tokenText

displayFormats.name: displayFormats
displayFormats.description: Pattern how different {@link sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay displayFormats} are rendered

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ActionToolbarActionAlignment
symbols.description: Defines the alignment of the ActionToolbarAction action control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType
symbols.description: Enumeration of the possible basic data types In Field and FilterField different data types can be used. This data types might be model dependent. To handle them model independent internally basic types are used.

properties.name: Boolean
properties.description: Data type represents a boolean

properties.name: Date
properties.description: Data type represents a date

properties.name: DateTime
properties.description: Data type represents a date with time

properties.name: Numeric
properties.description: Data type represents a number. (This can be integer, float or any other numeric type.)

properties.name: String
properties.description: Data type represents a string

properties.name: Time
properties.description: Data type represents a time

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: Data type represents a unit. This means a composite type with a number and a unit part is used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated
symbols.description: Enumeration of the validated state of conditions If a Condition is chosen from a field help or validated against a field help it is set to be validated. In this case the corresponding item in the field help is shown as selected. If the validated state of the Condition is undefined this means it is not defined if it is validated or not.

properties.name: NotValidated
properties.description: Condition is not validated

properties.name: Validated
properties.description: Condition is validated

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ContentMode
symbols.description: Defines in which mode the content of a Field, FilterField or MultiValueField is rendered.

properties.name: Display
properties.description: Display mode for single value

properties.name: DisplayMultiLine
properties.description: Display mode for multiline single value

properties.name: DisplayMultiValue
properties.description: Display mode for multiple values

properties.name: Edit
properties.description: Edit mode for single value

properties.name: EditForHelp
properties.description: Edit mode for single value field if a field help is assigned To support field help, in some cases a different control needs to be rendered.

properties.name: EditMultiLine
properties.description: Edit mode for multiple lines single value

properties.name: EditMultiValue
properties.description: Edit mode for multiple values

properties.name: EditOperator
properties.description: Edit mode for operator dependent controls This is used for single value and only one operator.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode
symbols.description: Defines in what mode a Field or FilterField is rendered.

properties.name: Disabled
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in disabled mode

properties.name: Display
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in display mode

properties.name: Editable
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in editable mode

properties.name: EditableDisplay
properties.description: If more then one control is rendered by the Field or FilterField control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are in display mode.

properties.name: EditableReadOnly
properties.description: If more then one control is rendered by the Field or FilterField control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are read-only.

properties.name: ReadOnly
properties.description: Field or FilterField is rendered in read-only mode

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay
symbols.description: Defines the output of a Field or FilterField control. For the Field control it defines how the value and additionalValue properties are formatted. For the FilterField control it defines how key and description of equal conditions are formatted.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Only the description is displayed

properties.name: DescriptionValue
properties.description: The description and the value (key) are displayed in the field. The value (key) is displayed after the description in brackets.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Only the value (key) is displayed

properties.name: ValueDescription
properties.description: The value (key) and the description are displayed in the field. The description is displayed after the value (key) in brackets.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.OutParameterMode
symbols.description: Defines the mode of the OutParameter element.

properties.name: Always
properties.description: The value in the OutParameter element is always set

properties.name: WhenEmpty
properties.description: The value in theOutParameter element is only set if it was empty before

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PersistenceMode
symbols.description: Enumeration of the preferred persistence mode for personalization changes.

properties.name: Auto
properties.description: Personalization changes are created and implicitly persisted only in case no additional VariantManagement control reference could be found. If a sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement has been found, it will be used instead.

properties.name: Global
properties.description: Personalization changes are created in the flexibility layer using ignoreVariantManagement: true

properties.name: Transient
properties.description: Personalization changes are not persisted

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PropagationReason
symbols.description: Enumeration of the propagation reason in the condition propagation callback of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp}

properties.name: ControlChange
properties.description: Triggered by connected control after processing valuehelp output

properties.name: Info
properties.description: Triggered by valuehelp itself on getItemForValue

properties.name: Select
properties.description: Triggered by valuehelp itself on selection

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.SelectType
symbols.description: Enumeration of the possible selection types

properties.name: Add
properties.description: the given conditions are just added to the existing ones, if not already existing.

properties.name: Remove
properties.description: The given conditions are removed.

properties.name: Set
properties.description: The given condition are just set and replacing the existing ones.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Field
symbols.description: The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the Field. For example, if a date type is used, a {@link sap.m.DatePicker DatePicker} is rendered.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the field. To display the key and the description in one field, the key must be set on the value property.

properties.name: additionalValue
properties.description: The additional value of the field. To display the key and the description in one field, the description must be set on the additionalValue property.

events.name: change
events.description: This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the Field. If a FieldHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the FieldHelp items.

valid.name: valid
valid.description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new Field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

events.name: change

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the Field. If a FieldHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the FieldHelp items.

valid.name: valid
valid.description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

events.description: This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

methods.name: attachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oData
parameters.description: An application-specific payload object that will be passed to the event handler along with the event object when firing the event

parameters.name: fnFunction
parameters.description: The function to be called when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object to call the event handler with. Defaults to this sap.ui.mdc.Field itself

methods.description: Attaches event handler fnFunction to the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.ui.mdc.Field. When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.mdc.Field itself. This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

methods.name: detachChange

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.description: The function to be called, when the event occurs

parameters.name: oListener
parameters.description: Context object on which the given function had to be called

methods.description: Detaches event handler fnFunction from the {@link #event:change change} event of this sap.ui.mdc.Field. The passed function and listener object must match the ones used for event registration.

returnValue.description: Value of property additionalValue

returnValue.description: conditions of the field

returnValue.description: Reference to this to allow method chaining

parameters.description: DataType to be set

methods.description: Gets a new value for property dataType. The type of data handled by the field. The type is used to parse, format, and validate the value. Note: If the value property is bound to a model using a type, this type is used. In this case the value of the dataType property is ignored.

deprecated.text: Not supported, the type in the binding to the value property is used.

methods.description: Gets a new value for property dataTypeConstraints. The constraints of the type specified in dataType. Note: If the value property is bound to a model using a type, this type is used. In this case the values of the dataType property and the dataTypeConstraints property are ignored.

deprecated.text: Not supported, the Constraints of the type in the binding to the value property is used.

deprecated.text: Not supported, the FormatOptions of the type in the binding to the value property is used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType
symbols.description: This class represents a type that is used to map an array of conditions to a single-value control (such as Input or Text control).

parameters.name: oFormatOptions

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Type of the value of the condition (used for formatting, parsing and validating)

operators.name: operators
operators.description: Possible operators to be used in the condition

display.name: display
display.description: DisplayFormat used to visualize a value

fieldHelpID.name: fieldHelpID
fieldHelpID.description: ID of the field help to determine the key and description // TODO: async request????

hideOperator.name: hideOperator
hideOperator.description: If set, only the value of the condition is shown, but no operator //TODO

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of field. Used to get a key or description from the value help using in/out parameters. (In a table, the value help might be connected to a different row)

originalDateType.name: originalDateType
originalDateType.description: Type used on field, for example, for date types; a different type is used internally to have different formatOptions

additionalType.name: additionalType
additionalType.description: additional Type used on other part of a field. (This is the case for unit fields.)

compositeTypes.name: compositeTypes
compositeTypes.description: additional Types used for parts of a CompositeType

getConditions.name: getConditions
getConditions.description: Function to get the existing conditions of the field. Only used if isUnit is set. TODO: better solution

asyncParsing.name: asyncParsing
asyncParsing.description: Callback function to tell the Field the parsing is asynchronous.

navigateCondition.name: navigateCondition
navigateCondition.description: Condition of keyboard navigation. If this is filled, no real parsing is needed as the condition has already been determined and is just returned

delegate.name: delegate
delegate.description: Field delegate to handle model-specific logic

preventGetDescription.name: preventGetDescription
preventGetDescription.description: If set, description is not read by formatValue as it is known that no description exists or might be set later

conditionModelName.name: conditionModelName
conditionModelName.description: Name of the ConditionModel, if bound to one

convertWhitespaces.name: convertWhitespaces
convertWhitespaces.description: If set, whitespaces will be replaced by special characters to display whitespaces in HTML

parameters.description: Formatting options

parameters.name: oConstraints
parameters.description: Value constraints

constructor.description: Constructor for a Conditions type.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.model.SimpleType.extend}.

methods.name: formatValue

returnValue.description: The formatted output value or a Promise resolving with the formatted value

parameters.name: aConditions
parameters.description: The conditions to be formatted

parameters.name: sTargetType
parameters.description: The target type; see {@link topic:ac56d92162ed47ff858fdf1ce26c18c4 Allowed Property Types} In addition to the standard target types sap.ui.mdc.raw can be used. In this case the value is not formatted and just forwarded to the target. If the value is an array representing data for a CompositeType the index of the needed raw value can be added to the name (For example if a unit should be forwarded as raw value sap.ui.mdc.raw:1 can be used).

throws.description: If formatting to the target type is not possible

methods.description: Formats the given conditions to an output value of the given target type. This values are formatted using the given data type. Depending of the operator and the configuration (set in FormatOptions) a description will be determined via given value help or delegate.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType.

methods.name: parseValue

returnValue.description: The array of conditions or a Promise resolving with the array of conditions. If there is no value null is returned.

parameters.name: vValue
parameters.description: The value to be parsed

parameters.name: sSourceType
parameters.description: The type of the given value; see {@link topic:ac56d92162ed47ff858fdf1ce26c18c4 Allowed Property Types} In addition to the standard source types sap.ui.mdc.raw can be used. In this case the value is not parsed and just used in the condition. If the value of the condition is an array representing data for a CompositeType the index of the needed raw value can be added to the name (For example if a unit should be forwarded as raw value sap.ui.mdc.raw:1 can be used).

throws.description: If parsing to the model type is not possible; the message of the exception is language dependent as it may be displayed on the UI

methods.description: Parses an external value of the given source type to an array of conditions that holds the value in model representation. These values are parsed using the given data type. Depending of the operator and the configuration (set in FormatOptions) a value will be determined via given value help or delegate.

methods.name: validateValue

returnValue.description: undefined or a Promise resolving with an undefined value

parameters.name: aConditions
parameters.description: The conditions to be validated

throws.description: If at least one of the values of the conditions is not valid for the given data type; the message of the exception is language dependent as it may be displayed on the UI

methods.description: Validates a given array of conditions. The values of the conditions are validated using the given data type.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase
symbols.description: The FieldBase control is the basic control to be used within the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field} and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls. It must not be used stand-alone.

properties.name: dataType
properties.description: The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value.

properties.name: dataTypeConstraints
properties.description: The constraints of the type specified in dataType.

properties.name: dataTypeFormatOptions
properties.description: The format options of the type specified in dataType.

properties.name: editMode
properties.description: Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates that user input is required.

properties.name: display
properties.description: Defines whether the value and/or description of the field is shown and in what order.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Defines the text directionality of the input field, for example RTL, LTR. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, for example Error, Warning, Success. Note: The visualization of the ValueState property is handled by the inner rendered control. If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this has not specified, a default text from the resource bundle is shown.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: multipleLines
properties.description: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description: Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
Defines the label text for the field.

This can be used by {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} or {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} controls to create a {@link sap.m.Label Label} control for the field.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to FieldBaseDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

properties.name: showEmptyIndicator
properties.description: If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode. This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display. Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp.

properties.name: _fieldHelpEnabled
properties.description: Internal property to bind the showValueHelp property of the internal Input control.

properties.name: _ariaAttributes
properties.description: Sets the ARIA attributes added to the inner control. The object contains ARIA attributes in an aria node. Additional attributes, such as role, autocomplete or valueHelpEnabled, are added on root level.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Optional content that can be rendered. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: contentEdit
aggregations.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: contentDisplay
aggregations.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: Internal content if no control set from outside.

aggregations.name: fieldInfo
aggregations.description: Optional FieldInfo used for detail information. This is only active in display mode. Note: If a special data type is defined or a content control is set, this is ignored.

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one FieldHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the FieldHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the FieldHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no FieldHelp should be added, but a default FieldHelp used instead.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: liveChange
events.description: This event is fired when the value of the field is changed, for example, each time a key is pressed. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a liveChange event.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the input

escPressed.name: escPressed
escPressed.description: Indicates that the ESC key triggered the event

previousValue.name: previousValue
previousValue.description: The value of the input before pressing ESC key

events.name: press
events.description: This event is fired if the inner control has a press event and this is fired.

events.name: submit
events.description: This event is fired when the user presses Enter. It allows the application to implement some submit logic. Note This event is only triggered if the field is editable.

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the last change event is synchronous, the Promise has already been resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated.

When called, the context of the event handler (its this) will be bound to oListener if specified, otherwise it will be bound to this sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase itself. This event is fired when the user presses Enter. It allows the application to implement some submit logic. Note This event is only triggered if the field is editable.

methods.description: Returns array of IDs of the elements which are the current targets of the association {@link #getAriaLabelledBy ariaLabelledBy}.

methods.name: getConditions

returnValue.description: Value of property conditions

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getConditions conditions}. Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. This should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel} using the corresponding fieldPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property must be used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}.
For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
For an Any (see {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator}) {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions='{$filters>/conditions/navPath*/propertyPath}' with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • navPath#42;/ as the navigation property name
  • propertyPath as the property name
Between navPath and propertyPath, */ is required. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}. Default value is [].

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}. Optional content that can be rendered. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

methods.name: getContentDisplay
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContentDisplay contentDisplay}. Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

methods.name: getContentEdit
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContentEdit contentEdit}. Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

methods.name: getControlForSuggestion

returnValue.description: Control for value help

methods.description:
Returns the control the value help is attached to.

In the case that number and unit are shown in different controls, this is the unit control, not the number control.

methods.name: getDataType

returnValue.description: Value of property dataType

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDataType dataType}. The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value. Default value is 'sap.ui.model.type.String'.

methods.name: getDataTypeConstraints

returnValue.description: Value of property dataTypeConstraints

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDataTypeConstraints dataTypeConstraints}. The constraints of the type specified in dataType.

methods.name: getDataTypeFormatOptions

returnValue.description: Value of property dataTypeFormatOptions

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDataTypeFormatOptions dataTypeFormatOptions}. The format options of the type specified in dataType.

methods.name: getDelegate

returnValue.description: Value of property delegate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDelegate delegate}. Path to FieldBaseDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer. Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getDisplay

returnValue.description: Value of property display

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplay display}. Defines whether the value and/or description of the field is shown and in what order. Default value is Value.

methods.name: getEditMode

returnValue.description: Value of property editMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEditMode editMode}. Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled. Default value is Editable.

methods.name: getFieldHelp
methods.description: ID of the element which is the current target of the association {@link #getFieldHelp fieldHelp}, or null.

methods.name: getFieldInfo
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getFieldInfo fieldInfo}. Optional FieldInfo used for detail information. This is only active in display mode. Note: If a special data type is defined or a content control is set, this is ignored.

methods.name: getFieldPath

returnValue.description: fieldPath of the field

methods.description: Gets fieldPath. If the conditions are bound to a ConditionModel, the FieldPath is determined from this binding.

methods.name: getLabel

returnValue.description: Value of property label

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getLabel label}. Defines the label text for the field. This can be used by {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} or {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} controls to create a {@link sap.m.Label Label} control for the field. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getMaxConditions

returnValue.description: Value of property maxConditions

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMaxConditions maxConditions}. Sets the maximum amount of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited amount of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown. Default value is -1.

methods.name: getMaxConditionsForHelp

returnValue.description: maxConditions used for valueHelp

methods.description: In the case that number and unit are shown in different controls, only one unit is supported. So the value help needs to be in single selection mode.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase.

methods.name: getMultipleLines

returnValue.description: Value of property multipleLines

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getMultipleLines multipleLines}. If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines an error is thrown. Default value is false.

methods.name: getPlaceholder

returnValue.description: Value of property placeholder

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPlaceholder placeholder}. Defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getRequired

returnValue.description: Value of property required

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRequired required}. Indicates that user input is required. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowEmptyIndicator

returnValue.description: Value of property showEmptyIndicator

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowEmptyIndicator showEmptyIndicator}. If set, an empty Field renders an empty-indicator in display mode. This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display. Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or FieldHelp. Default value is false.

methods.name: getTextAlign

returnValue.description: Value of property textAlign

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextAlign textAlign}. Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored. Default value is Initial.

methods.name: getTextDirection

returnValue.description: Value of property textDirection

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTextDirection textDirection}. Defines the text directionality of the input field, for example RTL, LTR. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored. Default value is Inherit.

methods.name: getValueState

returnValue.description: Value of property valueState

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValueState valueState}. Visualizes the validation state of the control, for example Error, Warning, Success. Note: The visualization of the ValueState property is handled by the inner rendered control. If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized. Default value is None.

methods.name: getValueStateText

returnValue.description: Value of property valueStateText

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getValueStateText valueStateText}.

Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this has not specified, a default text from the resource bundle is shown.

methods.name: getWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property width

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getWidth width}.

Defines the width of the control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase
symbols.description: Base type for the FieldHelp association in the FieldBase controls.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: The conditions of the selected items. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

properties.name: validateInput
properties.description:
If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

aggregations.name: _popover
aggregations.description: internal popover

events.name: select
events.description: This event is fired when a value is selected in the field help. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

conditions.name: conditions
conditions.description: The selected conditions Note: A condition has the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

add.name: add
add.description: If set, the selected conditions are added by the listening control, otherwise they replace the existing ones

close.name: close
close.description:
Indicator if the field help is closed while selection

since: 1.77.0

events.name: navigate
events.description: This event is fired when a value help entry is navigated using arrow keys. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

condition.name: condition
condition.description: The navigated condition Note A condition has the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

itemId.name: itemId
itemId.description:
The ID of the navigated item

This is the DOM reference needed for ARIA support to point to the navigated item.

leaveFocus.name: leaveFocus
leaveFocus.description: If set the focus visualization should be moved back to the field

events.name: dataUpdate
events.description: This event is fired when the data of the FieldHelp element has been changed. This might be needed to trigger an update for formatting a key with it's description. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

events.name: disconnect
events.description: This event is fired when the FieldHelp element is disconnected from a control. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

events.name: open
events.description: This event is fired when the field help is opened.

events.name: afterClose
events.description: This event is fired after the field help has been closed.

events.name: switchToValueHelp
events.description:
This event is fired if suggestion should be closed and value help should be opened.

The opening must be handled by the field as focus and accessibility handling is needed.

parameters.name: sId

events.name: afterClose
events.description: This event is fired after the field help has been closed.

events.name: dataUpdate
events.description: This event is fired when the data of the FieldHelp element has been changed. This might be needed to trigger an update for formatting a key with it's description. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

events.name: disconnect
events.description: This event is fired when the FieldHelp element is disconnected from a control. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

events.name: navigate

condition.name: condition

The ID of the navigated item

This is the DOM reference needed for ARIA support to point to the navigated item.

leaveFocus.name: leaveFocus
leaveFocus.description: If set the focus visualization should be moved back to the field

events.description: This event is fired when a value help entry is navigated using arrow keys. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

events.name: open
events.description: This event is fired when the field help is opened.

events.name: select

close.name: close

events.description: This event is fired when a value is selected in the field help. Note: This event must only be handled by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

events.name: switchToValueHelp

The opening must be handled by the field as focus and accessibility handling is needed.

methods.description: Connects the FieldHelp element to a control. If the FieldHelp element is used as an association to multiple controls, it has to know the currently active control to open and interact. If the FieldHelp element is connected to a control, the disconnected event is fired to inform the previously connected control. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: getValidateInput

returnValue.description: Value of property validateInput

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValidateInput validateInput}. If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs. If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.) Default value is true.

methods.name: getValueHelpEnabled

returnValue.description: If set, value help text needs to be rendered

methods.description:
Checks if a "valueHelp enabled" text should be rendered for screenreader.

If a complex value help exists on a field a corresponding text needs to be read out by screen readers. For simple "combobox" cases this is not needed. So this depends on the specific value help.

methods.name: initBeforeOpen

parameters.name: bSuggestion
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether field help is opened for suggestion or for complex help

methods.description: Calls initialization of the FieldHelp before the FieldHelp is really opened. This is called in Typeahead on first letter before the FieldHelp is opened with a delay. So the content can be determined in the delegate coding early. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isFocusInHelp

returnValue.description: if true, focus goes to the value help, if false it stays in the calling control.

methods.description: Determines if the focus is set in the value help or stays in the calling control.

returnValue.description: true if open

parameters.name: bCheckClosing
parameters.description: If set a closing field help is handled as closed

methods.description: Determines if the field help is open. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isUsableForValidation

returnValue.description: True if field help can be used for input validation

methods.description: Defines if the field help is used for input validation.

methods.name: isValidationSupported

methods.description: Defines if the field help supports input validation to determine key or description

parameters.name: iStep

methods.description: Triggers navigation in the field help. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: onFieldChange
methods.description: Triggers some logic that must be executed in FieldHelp element if a Change event on the connected field is fired. This is done if the corresponding field value is changed (not during navigation). Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: bSuggestion
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether field help is opened for suggestion or for complex help

methods.name: openByClick

returnValue.description: If true, the field help should open when user clicks into the connected field

methods.description: Determines if the field help should be opened when the user clicks into the connected field. Opening the field help must be triggered by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: openByTyping

returnValue.description: if true, the field help should open by typing. If determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned

methods.description: Determines if the field help should be opened when something is typed into the field. Opening the field help must be triggered by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: removeFocus
methods.description: The focus visualization of the field help needs to be removed as the user starts typing into the field.

parameters.description: New value for property conditions

Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is [].

parameters.description: New value for property filterValue

Note: This only takes effect if the FieldHelp element supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: setValidateInput

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bValidateInput
parameters.description: New value for property validateInput

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getValidateInput validateInput}. If this property is set, the user input is validated against the field help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error occurs. If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the field help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.) When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: skipOpening
methods.description: Skips the opening of the field help if it is pending because of loading content. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

parameters.name: bSuggestion
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether field help is opened for suggestion or for complex help

methods.description: Toggles the open state of the field help. Note: This function must only be called by the control the FieldHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

Delegate class for sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldHelpBase.

Only then does the field help continue opening or reading data.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp
symbols.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} that shows a value help dialog.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description: Defines the module path of the metadata delegate.

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

properties.name: keyPath
properties.description:
The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.

properties.name: descriptionPath
properties.description: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

properties.name: showConditionPanel
properties.description: Determines if a condition panel is shown.

properties.name: title
properties.description: Title text that appears in the dialog header.

properties.name: noDialog
properties.description: If set, the field help doesn't open a value help dialog, but just displays the content. It behaves like in the case of a suggestion but without any search.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

properties.name: _enableOK
properties.description: Internal property to bind the OK button to enable or disable it.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content of the field help. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.)

aggregations.name: suggestContent
aggregations.description: Content for suggestion. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for suggestion is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

aggregations.name: dialogContent
aggregations.description: Content for dialog. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for the dialog is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

aggregations.name: filterBar
aggregations.description: FilterBar control of the field help.

aggregations.name: inParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

aggregations.name: outParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.

aggregations.name: _dialog
aggregations.description: internal dialog

aggregations.name: _filterBar
aggregations.description: Internal FilterBar control of the field help. (If no external FilterBar used.)

aggregations.name: collectiveSearchItems
aggregations.description: Items for collective searches. If used, a field to switch value helps will be shown. If the value help is switched, the contentRequest function of the delegate is called and the chosen key is provided. Note: Icons are not supported.

events.name: dataRequested
events.description: This event is fired when a description for a key or a key for a description is requested, and no data table with list binding is assigned. This is the case if a Field or FilterField shows the description of the value. and the value is formatted or a new input is parsed.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new FieldValueHelp. If a more complex value help is needed, the application can add a table to this field help. As the behavior depends on the used table control in this case, a wrapper is used between the used control and the FieldValueHelp element. Note: If a FieldValueHelp element is connected to a field, it gets the BindingContext of this field. So the in and out parameters are done in this context. Therefore bind the content table in such a way that that it finds its data also in the BindingContext of the field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getInParameters
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getInParameters inParameters}.

Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

methods.name: getKeyPath

returnValue.description: Value of property keyPath

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getKeyPath keyPath}. The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items. If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp.

methods.name: getNoDialog

returnValue.description: Value of property noDialog

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNoDialog noDialog}. If set, the field help doesn't open a value help dialog, but just displays the content. It behaves like in the case of a suggestion but without any search. Default value is false.

methods.name: getOutParameters
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getOutParameters outParameters}.

Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.

methods.name: getShowConditionPanel

returnValue.description: Value of property showConditionPanel

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowConditionPanel showConditionPanel}. Determines if a condition panel is shown. Default value is false.

methods.name: getSuggestContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSuggestContent suggestContent}. Content for suggestion. To support different types of content (for example sap.m.Table), a specific wrapper is used to map the functionality of the content control to the field help. The content control is assigned to the wrapper. The filter logic must be implemented in the wrapper control. The filtering is triggered by user interaction (type-ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar). (If FilterBar is in LiveMode and in parameters are used, this also triggers filtering.) Note: If no special content for suggestion is provided, the content of the content aggregation is used.

Indicator of item is chosen via press or enter or via a selection

Depending of the field help logic the field help needs to be closed on click, but not on multi-selection. (If a Table is used, clicking an item in the suggestion closes it bit activation the check box not.)

since: 1.76.0

constructor.description: Constructor for a new FieldValueHelpContentWrapperBase. The FieldValueHelp element supports different types of content. To map the content control API to the FieldValueHelp element, a wrapper is needed. This base class just defines the API. Note: All events and functions must only be used by the corresponding field help. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.name: aFilters
parameters.description: Filter objects

parameters.name: sSearch
parameters.description: Search string (for $search request)

methods.description: Applies the entered filters and search string to the content control (table). As the way how filters and search are applied depends on the ListBinding and the used content control, this needs to be done in the wrapper. If the ListBinding in the wrapper is suspended, it must be resumed in this function after setting the filters. It will not be resumed in the FieldValueHelp element. There applyFilters is only called if the filters should really be set.
