symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelpMTableWrapper
symbols.description: Wrapper to use a sap.m.Table control as content of a FieldValueHelp element

aggregations.name: table
aggregations.description:
Table of the field help. As the FieldValueHelp element cannot know the semantic of the items, the caller is responsible for the item handling. The items must be active to allow interaction and selection. This can be handled automatically if the following applies:
  • No keyPath or descriptionPath is specified for the FieldValueHelp element
  • Table has no paging
  • Table uses ColumnListItem as item
  • The first column if the table contains the key and the second column the description, using a Text control
For everything else the application has to implement the logic. If the ListBinding of the table is initially created to be suspended, no filtering or selection is triggered. So the table is empty. Upon user interaction (type ahead, search request, or search from FilterBar) the ListBinding is resumed so the filter is executed. If FilterBar is in LiveMode, and InParameters are used, this also triggers filtering.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

This is a wrapper to use a {@link sap.m.Table Table} control as content. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.InParameter
symbols.description: The InParameter element is used in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldValueHelp FieldValueHelp} element.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the in parameter. Here the data of the model can be bound. In the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} case this is the {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. Note: Here we recommend one-way-binding.

properties.name: helpPath
properties.description: Name of the field in the ListBinding used in the value help. This is needed to define the filter for the corresponding field in the help.

properties.name: initialValueFilterEmpty
properties.description: If set, an initial value of InParameter starts a filtering for the empty operator. Note: This property must not be used for {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} and if bound to {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. In this case, a filtering for the empty operator must be defined by the assigned conditions. Note: This property must only be set if the data type used supports a filtering for the empty operator. Note: Do not set this property if an empty string is a valid key for the InParameter used.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.ListFieldHelp
symbols.description: A field help used in the FieldHelp association of controls based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} that shows a list of items.

properties.name: filterList
properties.description: If set, the items of the list are filtered based on filterValue. If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false. If not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

properties.name: useFirstMatch
properties.description: If set, getKeyForText returns the first item that matches the text. This is the case if the text of the item starts with the text entered.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items of the field help. The key of the items is not shown in the list, but is used as a value of the connected field. If the additionalText for all the items is not used, the column will not be displayed. Note: At the moment, icons are not supported. Note: If {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ListFieldHelpItem ListFieldHelpItem} elements are used as items, the items are grouped and sorted by the value provided in the groupKey property of the item. The value provided in the groupText property will be shown as group header.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ListFieldHelp. This field help supports only single selection. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Advanced Filters button shows the filter dialog.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

properties.name: showAdaptFiltersButton
properties.description:
Determines whether the Adapt Filters button is visible in the filter bar.
Note: If the p13nMode property does not contain the value Item, it is ignored.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.FilterBarBase
symbols.description: The FilterBarBase control is used as a faceless base class for common functionality of any MDC FilterBar derivation.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Defines the path to the metadata retrieval class for the FilterBarBase control. It basically identifies the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} file that provides the required APIs to create the filter bar content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Note: This property must not be bound.

properties.name: liveMode
properties.description:
Triggers a search automatically after a filter value has been changed.
Note: The liveMode property only operates in non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if the liveMode property is active, the following applies:
The error message box is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored.

properties.name: showMessages
properties.description: Displays possible errors during the search in a message box.

properties.name: showGoButton
properties.description:
Determines whether the Go button is visible in the filter bar.
Note: If the liveMode property is set to true, it is ignored.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Specifies the filter conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: propertyInfo
properties.description:
Specifies the filter metadata.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for SAPUI5 flexibility/ Fiori Elements. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: suspendSelection
properties.description: If set to true, all search requests are ignored. Once it has been set to false, a search is triggered immediately if one or more search requests have been triggered in the meantime but were ignored based on the setting.

properties.name: _filterCount
properties.description: Binds the text of the Adapt Filters button.

aggregations.name: filterItems
aggregations.description: Contains all the displayed {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField filter fields} of the FilterBarBase control.

aggregations.name: basicSearchField
aggregations.description: Contains the optional basic search field.

aggregations.name: layout
aggregations.description: Internal hidden aggregation to hold the inner layout.

associations.name: variantBackreference
associations.description: {@link sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement VariantManagement} control for the filter bar. Note: this association is only required, for being able to get information from {@link topic:a8e55aa2f8bc4127923b20685a6d1621 SAPUI5 Flexibility} whenever a variant was applied, with 'apply automatically' set to true. Note: this association may only be assigned once.

parameters.name: bValue
parameters.description: Indicates if set to true that the default behavior is to be ignored

methods.description: Determines whether the default behavior of the suspendSelection property is overruled. This can only happen during the suspension of the selection. If this property is set to true, a possible queue of search requests is ignored during the final suspendSelection operation. Once the suspension of the selection is over, this value will be set to false.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bLiveMode
parameters.description: New value for property liveMode

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getLiveMode liveMode}. Triggers a search automatically after a filter value has been changed.
Note: The liveMode property only operates in non-mobile scenarios.
Additionally, if the liveMode property is active, the following applies:
The error message box is not displayed, and the showMessages property is ignored. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bSuspendSelection
parameters.description: New value for property suspendSelection

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSuspendSelection suspendSelection}. If set to true, all search requests are ignored. Once it has been set to false, a search is triggered immediately if one or more search requests have been triggered in the meantime but were ignored based on the setting. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.filterbar.vh.FilterBar
symbols.description:
The FilterBar control is used to display filter properties in a user-friendly manner to populate values for a query. The filters are arranged in a logical row that is divided depending on the space available and the width of the filters. The Go button triggers the search event, and the Show Filters button shows the additional filter field.
The FilterBar control creates and handles the filters based on the provided metadata information. The metadata information is provided via the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBarDelegate FilterBarDelegate} implementation. This implementation has to be provided by the application.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.FilterField
symbols.description: The FilterField control is used to filter data based on the conditions. The conditions are managed in the corresponding {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. That is why the conditions property must be bound to the related conditions in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionModel ConditionModel}. The type of this data must be defined in the dataType property.

properties.name: operators
properties.description:
Supported operator names for conditions.

If empty, default operators depending on used data type are used.

properties.name: defaultOperator
properties.description: Default operator name for conditions. If empty, the relevant default operator depending on the data type used is taken. Note: defaultOperator can be the name of an {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator Operator} or the instance itself.

events.name: change
events.description: This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

valid.name: valid
valid.description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid

conditions.name: conditions
conditions.description: Conditions of the field. This includes all conditions, not only the changed ones.

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. The FilterField should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter
symbols.description:
Interface for controls or entities which can serve as filters in the sap.ui.mdc.Table & sap.ui.mdc.Chart. The following methods need to be implemented:
  • getConditions - Part of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.IFilterSource} interface.
  • validate - The validate method should return a promise which resolves after the IFilter interface has handled its inner validation. The getConditions method will be called subsequently by the filtered control.
  • getSearch - Note: The getSearch method can optionally be implemented and should return a string for approximate string matching implemented in the backend.
The following events need to be implemented:
  • search - This event should be fired once a filtering should be executed on the IFilter using control.
  • filtersChanged - Note: The filtersChanged event can optionally be implemented and should be fired whenever a filter value has changed. This event will be used to display an overlay on the IFilter consuming control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Link
symbols.description:
A Link control can be used to handle navigation scenarios with one or more targets through direct navigation or by opening a Panel.
It can also be used to display additional content, such as ContactDetails on the Panel. Note: Navigation targets are determined by the implementation of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.LinkDelegate}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.AdaptationMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for adaptation. The following methods are available:
  • getEngine - Provides access to the adaptation engine singleton instance.
  • retrieveInbuiltFilter - Provides access to the AdaptationFilterBar initialization
  • getInbuiltFilter - Returns the AdaptationFilterBar instance, if available.
  • getAdaptationConfigAttribute - Returns an adaptationConfig attribute.
Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:
  • exit

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.DelegateMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated asynchronous handling for delegate modules and their initialization. The following methods are available:
  • awaitControlDelegate - Provides access to the delegate initialization Promise.
  • getControlDelegate - Returns the delegate instance, if available.
  • getPayload - Returns the payload object set for the delegate property.
  • getTypeUtil - Returns the typeUtil made available by the delegate module
  • initControlDelegate - Loads and initializes the delegate module related to the enhanced control.
  • initPropertyHelper - Loads and initializes the property helper related to the enhanced control.
  • awaitPropertyHelper - Provides access to the property helper initialization Promise.
  • getPropertyHelper - Returns the property helper instance, if available.
Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:
  • applySettings
  • exit
  • init
  • setDelegate
The prototype.init wrapper creates the following instance fields:
  • bDelegateInitialized - Indicator for the availability of delegates
  • bDelegateLoading - Indicates whether the initialization of delegate modules is triggered but not yet completed (loading necessary)

methods.name: awaitControlDelegate

returnValue.description: Returns a Promise reflecting the delegate initialization

throws.description: Throws an error if the delegate module is not available

methods.description: Provides access to the delegate initialization Promise. Note: initControlDelegate must be called to start the delegate initialization

methods.name: getControlDelegate

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.FilterIntegrationMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated handling for external IFilter integration The following methods are available:
  • setFilter - The setter for the filter association
  • _validateFilter - Validates the provided IFilter control instance and may return an error
  • rebind - Executes a the rebind method for the given control instance.
To use the FilterIntegrationMixin, the implementing Control requires the filter associaton. Additionally, the following methods are necessary to be implemented:
  • _rebind
  • isFilteringEnabled
Hooks that are called by the FilterIntegrationMixin if implemented in the control.
  • _onFilterProvided(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that a valid filter association has been provided. The provided filter instance is passed.
  • _onFilterRemoved(oFilter: sap.ui.mdc.IFilter) - Notifies the control that the filter association has been removed. The removed filter instance is passed.
  • _onFiltersChanged(oEvent) - Called when the search event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.
  • _onFilterSearch(oEvent) - Called when the filtersChanged event of the filter is fired. The event object is passed.

methods.name: rebind
methods.description: Executes a rebind considering the provided external and inbuilt filtering.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.PromiseMixin
symbols.description: Enhances a given control prototype with a management mechanism for lifecycle related promises. Calling any of the enhanced methods after control exit will result in a no-op.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.mixin.PropertyHelperMixin
symbols.description:
Enhances a given control prototype with consolidated asynchronous handling for providing a PropertyHelper The following methods are available:
  • initPropertyHelper - Loads and initializes the property helper related to the enhanced control.
  • awaitPropertyHelper - Provides access to the property helper initialization Promise.
  • finalizePropertyHelper - Finalizes the propertyHelper fetching all available propertyInfo via a given control delegate.
  • isPropertyHelperFinal - Indicates if the propertyHelper for this control allready contains all available propertyInfo.
  • getPropertyHelper - Returns the property helper instance, if available.
Additionally, the following methods are wrapped:
  • applySettings
  • exit
  • init

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField
symbols.description: A MultiValueField control can hold multiple values. The values are stored as items. A MultiValueField control can be used to bind its items to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the MultiValueField control.

properties.name: delegate

Path to the MultiValueFieldDelegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.

Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the items when it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the promise has already been resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the items have been updated. The MultiValueField control should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that need to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil
symbols.description: Utility class for state handling of MDC controls. The StateUtil class is offering a generic way to retrieve states and set a desired state for a given MDC control. The StateUtil class is tightly coupled to the SAPUI5 flexibility integration of MDC controls. To use the APIs of Stateutil, the given MDC control instance needs to fully enable all available p13nMode options. This way, Stateutil can create the required changes and retrieve the relevant state of each control.

methods.name: applyExternalState

returnValue.description: Promise that resolves after all changes have been applied

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: The control that is used to create changes and to which changes are made

parameters.name: oState
parameters.description: The state in which the control is represented

methods.description:
Creates and applies the necessary changes for a given control and state. Note:The changes are created in the same order as the objects are passed into the state object attributes. For example, by adding two objects into the items attribute of the oState object, the first entry is created, and the second entry is created on top of the first change. The item state is applied for each provided object in the given order in the array and uses the provided position. If no index or only an invalid index has been provided, the item is added to the array after the last item in the affected control's item aggregation. In addition the following attributes can be used to remove a state:
  • sorted - Set to false in the sorters scope to remove a sorter/code>.
  • grouped - Set to false in the groupLevels scope to remove a grouping.
  • visible - Set to false to remove an aggregation item.
  • aggregated - Set to false to remove an aggregation.
Note:To improve the performance, you should avoid additional calls of the controls delegate. To do this, the propertyInfo property of the relevant control can be enriched with the properties used in the provided state.

After the returned Promise has been resolved, the returned state is in sync with the according state object of the MDC control (for example, filterConditions for the FilterBar control).

properties.name: Auto

properties.name: Fixed

properties.name: Multi

properties.name: None

properties.name: Single

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Table
symbols.description: A metadata-driven table to simplify the usage of existing tables, such as the ResponsiveTable and GridTable controls. The metadata needs to be provided via the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate TableDelegate} implementation as {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.PropertyInfo}.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the table.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the table.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Personalization options for the table.
Note: The order of the options does not influence the position on the UI.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to TableDelegate module that provides the required APIs to create table content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description: Semantic level of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}.

properties.name: autoBindOnInit
properties.description: Determines whether to bind the table automatically after the initial creation or re-creation of the table.

properties.name: header
properties.description: Header text that is shown in the table.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Determines whether the header text is shown in the table. Regardless of its value, the given header text is used to label the table correctly for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: selectionMode
properties.description: Selection mode of the table. Specifies whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance.

properties.name: showRowCount
properties.description:
Determines whether the number of rows is shown along with the header text. If set to false, the number of rows is not shown on the user interface.
Note:
For better performance dedicated OData requests should not be sent. The count mode must be configured either in the model or in the binding of the table.
This property can only be used if the back-end service supports row count.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the {@link sap.m.ListBase#getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the {@link sap.ui.table.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Determines the text shown if the table has no data.

properties.name: sortConditions
properties.description:
Defines the sort conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Defines the filter conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: groupConditions
properties.description:
Defines the group conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

properties.name: aggregateConditions
properties.description:
Defines the aggregate conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes.

properties.name: enableExport
properties.description: Determines whether the table data export is enabled.

properties.name: busyIndicatorDelay
properties.description: The delay in milliseconds after which the busy indicator is shown.

properties.name: enableColumnResize
properties.description: Determines whether column resizing is enabled.

properties.name: showPasteButton
properties.description: Determines whether the Paste button is visible.

properties.name: enablePaste
properties.description: Determines whether the Paste button is enabled.

properties.name: multiSelectMode
properties.description: Defines the multi-selection mode for the control. If this property is set to the Default value, the ResponsiveTable type control renders the Select All checkbox in the column header, otherwise the Deselect All icon is rendered. This property is used with the selectionMode="Multi".

properties.name: enableAutoColumnWidth
properties.description: Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set.

aggregations.name: type
aggregations.description: Type of the table.

aggregations.name: columns
aggregations.description: Columns of the table.

aggregations.name: creationRow
aggregations.description: This row can be used for user input to create new data if {@link sap.ui.mdc.TableType TableType} is "Table". Note: Once the binding supports creating transient records, this aggregation will be removed.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description: Additional/external actions available for the table.

aggregations.name: variant
aggregations.description: <code>VariantManagement<code> control for the table.

aggregations.name: quickFilter
aggregations.description: Additional Filter for the table.

aggregations.name: rowSettings
aggregations.description: Settings for the table rows. Note: Each time the properties of the settings are changed, they have to be applied again via setRowSettings for the changes to take effect.

aggregations.name: dataStateIndicator
aggregations.description: DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.

associations.name: filter
associations.description: Control or object which enables the table to do filtering, such as {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar}. Also see {@link sap.ui.mdc.IFilter}.

events.description: This event is fired when a row in the table is pressed.

events.name: selectionChange
events.description: This event is fired when the selection in the table is changed.

bindingContext.description: The binding context of the pressed row

methods.name: focusRow

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves after the focus has been set

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The index of the row that is to be focused

parameters.name: bFirstInteractiveElement
parameters.description: Indicates whether to set the focus on the first interactive element inside the row

methods.description: Sets the focus on the row. If bFirstInteractiveElement is true, and there are interactive elements inside the row, sets the focus on the first interactive element. Otherwise sets the focus on the first data cell, if the type is GridTableType, and on the entire row, if the type is ResponsiveTableType. If the given index is not visible, the table scrolls to it automatically. In this case the same rules apply as in {@link #scrollToIndex}.

returnValue.description: Current state of the table

methods.description: Fetches the current state of the table (as a JSON) Note: This API may return attributes corresponding to the p13nMode property configuration.

methods.name: getDataStateIndicator
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDataStateIndicator dataStateIndicator}. DataStateIndicator plugin that can be used to show binding-related messages. Note: The message filtering is not yet supported for this control. Therefore the {@link sap.m.plugins.DataStateIndicator#getEnableFiltering enableFiltering} property of the DataStateIndicator plugin must not be set to true.

methods.name: getDelegate

returnValue.description: Value of property delegate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDelegate delegate}. Path to TableDelegate module that provides the required APIs to create table content.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. Once the required module is associated, this property might not be needed any longer. Default value is ...see text or source.

methods.name: getEnableAutoColumnWidth

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAutoColumnWidth

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAutoColumnWidth enableAutoColumnWidth}. Enables automatic column width calculation based on metadata information if set to true. The column width calculation takes the type, column label, referenced properties, and many other metadata parameters into account. Providing a more precise maxLength value for the String type or precision value for numeric types can help this algorithm to produce better results. The calculated column widths can have a minimum of 3rem and a maximum of 20rem. Note: To customize the automatic column width calculation, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo can be used. To avoid the heuristic column width calculation for a particular column, the visualSettings.widthSettings key of the PropertyInfo must be set to null. This feature has no effect if the width property of the column is bound or its value is set. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableColumnResize

returnValue.description: Value of property enableColumnResize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableColumnResize enableColumnResize}. Determines whether column resizing is enabled. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableExport

returnValue.description: Value of property enableExport

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableExport enableExport}. Determines whether the table data export is enabled. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnablePaste

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnablePaste enablePaste}. Determines whether the Paste button is enabled. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectionMode selectionMode}. Selection mode of the table. Specifies whether single or multiple rows can be selected and how the selection can be extended. It may also influence the visual appearance. Default value is None.

methods.name: getShowPasteButton

returnValue.description: Value of property showPasteButton

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShowPasteButton showPasteButton}. Determines whether the Paste button is visible. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShowRowCount

returnValue.description: Value of property showRowCount

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShowRowCount showRowCount}. Determines whether the number of rows is shown along with the header text. If set to false, the number of rows is not shown on the user interface.
Note:
For better performance dedicated OData requests should not be sent. The count mode must be configured either in the model or in the binding of the table.
This property can only be used if the back-end service supports row count. Default value is true.

methods.name: getSortConditions

returnValue.description: Value of property sortConditions

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getSortConditions sortConditions}. Defines the sort conditions. Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is used exclusively for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.

methods.name: getThreshold

returnValue.description: Value of property threshold

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getThreshold threshold}. Number of records to be requested from the model. If the type property is set to ResponsiveTable, then it refers to the {@link sap.m.ListBase#getGrowingThreshold growingThreshold} property of ResponsiveTable. If the type property is set to Table, then it refers to the {@link sap.ui.table.Table#getThreshold threshold} property of GridTable.
Note: This property only takes effect if it is set to a positive integer value. Otherwise the table uses the default value of the corresponding table types. Default value is -1.

methods.name: scrollToIndex

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves after the table scrolls to the row with the given index

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The index of the row that should be scrolled into the visible area

methods.description: Scrolls the table to the row with the given index. Depending on the table type, this might cause additional requests. If the given index is -1, it will scroll to the end of the table based on the length of the underlying binding. If the length is not final, it will only scroll to the end of the current binding and might trigger a request for additional entries. This also applies in case of a responsive table with growing enabled.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.Column
symbols.description: The column for the metadata-driven table with the template, which is shown if the rows have data.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the column.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Minimum width of the column.

properties.name: header
properties.description: The column header text.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Defines whether the column header is visible.

properties.name: hAlign
properties.description: Horizontal alignment of the content.

properties.name: importance
properties.description: Importance of the column. It is used to show or hide the column based on the Table configuration.

properties.name: dataProperty
properties.description: The data property related to the column.

aggregations.name: template
aggregations.description: Template for the column.

aggregations.name: creationTemplate
aggregations.description: CreationRow template. Note: Once the binding supports creating transient records, this aggregation will be removed.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: Optional ID for the new object; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.CreationRow
symbols.description: Row that allows the user to enter data in a row-shaped form if the {@link sap.ui.mdc.TableType TableType} is "Table". The form elements are aligned with the columns of the table and are created automatically based on the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column#getCreationTemplate creationTemplate} aggregation of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.Column}.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description:
Defines the maximum number of filter conditions for the property. Possible values that can be used:
  • 1 is a single-filter expression field
  • -1 is a multi-filter expression field
This information is for example used in the addItem method of the FilterBar control to forward this information to the created FilterField instance.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType
symbols.description: The table type info class for the metadata-driven table.

properties.name: growingMode
properties.description: Specifies the growing mode.

properties.name: showDetailsButton
properties.description:
Specifies whether the Show / Hide Details button for the ResponsiveTable scenario is shown. If the available screen space gets too narrow, the columns configured with High and Medium importance move to the pop-in area, while the columns with Low importance are hidden.
On mobile phones, the columns with Medium importance are also hidden.
As soon as the first column is hidden, this button appears in the table toolbar and gives the user the possibility to toggle the visibility of the hidden columns in the pop-in area.

properties.name: detailsButtonSetting
properties.description:
Defines which columns are hidden instead of moved into the pop-in area depending on their importance. See {@link sap.m.Column#getImportance} and {@link sap.m.Table#getHiddenInPopin} for more details. Note: To hide columns based on their importance, it's mandatory to set showDetailsButton="true".
If no priority is given, the default configuration of {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType#getShowDetailsButton} is used.
If this property is changed after the Table has been initialized, the new changes take effect only when the Show / Hide Details button is pressed a second time.

properties.name: popinLayout
properties.description: Defines the layout in which the table pop-in rows are rendered.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings
symbols.description: The RowSettings control is used to configure a row. This control can only be used in the context of the sap.ui.mdc.Table control to define row settings.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description: The highlight state of the rows. If the highlight is set to {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType sap.ui.core.MessageType.None} (default), no highlights are visible. Valid values for the highlight property are values of the enumerations {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType} or {@link sap.ui.core.IndicationColor}. Accessibility support is provided through the associated {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings#setHighlightText highlightText} property. If the highlight property is set to a value of {@link sap.ui.core.MessageType}, the highlightText property does not need to be set because a default text is used. However, the default text can be overridden by setting the highlightText property. In all other cases the highlightText property must be set.

properties.name: highlightText
properties.description: Defines the semantics of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.RowSettings#setHighlight highlight} property for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: navigated
properties.description: The navigated state of a row. If set to true, a navigation indicator is displayed at the end of the row.

aggregations.name: rowActions
aggregations.description:
The available actions for a row.

rowActions cannot be bound with a factory. Additionally, {@link sap.m.Table} only works with row actions of type navigation.

parameters.description: Optional ID for the new object; generated automatically if no non-empty ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for new RowSettings. Caution: Only use bindings which are bound against the rows, as working functionalities cannot be ensured for other binding types. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.util.PromiseCache
symbols.description: Provides a caching mechanism for promises. This API features Promise cancellation: resolve or reject handlers won't be called after removal of the promise, cache destruction or manual cancellation. Destroying the cache will cancel all registered promises and delete references. Convenience methods for promise creation, wrapping and replacement are offered.

methods.name: add

returnValue.description: Returns the newly created Promise

parameters.name: sName
parameters.description: Promise identifier

parameters.name: fnCreate
parameters.description: creation method or pre-created promise

methods.description:
Adds a promise to the promise cache using a string identifier and a creation method or given Promise. Calling add using an already existing identifier will cancel and replace the existing promise. Note: All unsettled promises will be cancelled on removal or cache destruction A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:
  • oPromise - The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve - Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject - Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove - Remove method for the newly created Promise

methods.name: cancel

returnValue.description: Returns the canceled Promise

parameters.name: vPromise
parameters.description: Promise or identifier

methods.description: Cancels an unsettled promise from the promise cache. Calling cancel twice is a no-op.

methods.name: clear
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

methods.name: destroy
methods.description: Provides cleanup functionality for the promise cache

methods.description: Rejects an existing promise from the promise cache

methods.name: resolve

methods.description:
Retrieves an existing promise from the promise cache. Automatically creates and returns a new promise if fnCreate is given. A given creation method will receive the following arguments on execution:
  • oPromise - The newly created Promise
  • fnResolve - Resolve method for the newly created Promise
  • fnReject - Reject method for the newly created Promise
  • fnRemove - Remove method for the newly created Promise

returnValue.description: Returns the retrieved promises

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique, stable key for the property. It must only contain characters allowed for IDs, see {@link sap.ui.core.ID}. Does not have to be an existing attribute in the data model or the technical name of an attribute in the data model.

properties.name: path
properties.description: The technical path for a data source property.

properties.name: label
properties.description: Translatable text that labels the property.

properties.name: visible
properties.description: Whether the property is or can be visible to a user.

properties.name: propertyInfos
properties.description: The availability of this property makes PropertyInfo a complex PropertyInfo. Provides a list of related properties (by name). These related properties must be no complex PropertyInfo to avoid deep nesting.

properties.name: typeConfig
properties.description: Object which contains type-specific information about the property, especially the type instance (for example, for model filter creation in Table rebind).

properties.name: extension
properties.description: Reserved attribute. Must not be provided by the delegate directly as part of the PropertyInfo, but separately in the fetchPropertyExtensions method of the delegate. The PropertyInfoExtension is a key-value map where the key is the property name and the value is the additional information. The structure of the additional information depends on the delegate. Used to add model-specific information. For example, for analytics in OData, see sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TableDelegate.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp
symbols.description: Element for the FieldHelp association in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase} controls.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: The conditions of the selected items. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

properties.name: delegate
properties.description:
Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization.

properties.name: filterValue
properties.description: The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

properties.name: validateInput
properties.description:
If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field.

If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.)

properties.name: _config
properties.description: internal configuration

properties.name: _valid
properties.description: Internal property to allow to bind the valid state to OK Button or make it available for all content controls

methods.description: Connects the ValueHelp element to a control. If the ValueHelp element is used as an association to multiple controls, it has to know the currently active control to open and interact. If the ValueHelp element is connected to a control, the disconnected event is fired to inform the previously connected control. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: getDelegate

returnValue.description: Value of property delegate

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDelegate delegate}. Path to the Delegate module that provides the required APIs to execute model-specific logic.
Note: Ensure that the related file can be requested (any required library has to be loaded before that).
Do not bind or modify the module. This property can only be configured during control initialization. Default value is ...see text or source.

Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDialog dialog}.

Container that is used and opened if the value help icon of the input field is pressed.

returnValue.description: Value of property filterValue

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFilterValue filterValue}. The value by which the help is filtered. Note: This only takes effect if the ValueHelp elements content supports filtering. Note: This property must only be set by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application. Default value is empty string.

parsedValue.name: parsedValue
parsedValue.description: Value parsed by type to fit the data type of the key

context.name: context
context.description: Contextual information provided by condition payload or inParameters/outParameters. This is only filled if the description needs to be determined for an existing condition.

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table the ValueHelp element might be connected to a different row.

checkKeyFirst.name: checkKeyFirst
checkKeyFirst.description: If set, the value help checks first if the value fits a key // TODO: not longer needed?

checkKey.name: checkKey
checkKey.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

checkDescription.name: checkDescription
checkDescription.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

conditionModelName.name: conditionModelName
conditionModelName.description: Name of the ConditionModel, in case of FilterField

caseSensitive.name: caseSensitive
caseSensitive.description: If set, the check is done case sensitive

parameters.description: Configuration

throws.description: if entry is not found or not unique

methods.description: Determines the item (key and description) for a given value. The value help checks if there is an item with a key or description that fits this value. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValuedHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp.

methods.name: getTypeahead
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getTypeahead typeahead}.

Container that is used and opened in typeahead

methods.name: getValidateInput

returnValue.description: Value of property validateInput

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getValidateInput validateInput}. If this property is set, the user input of the corresponding field is validated against the value help. If no entry is found for the user input, an error is shown on the field. If this property is not set, the user input is still checked against the value help. But if no entry is found, the user input is set to the field if the used data type allows this. (A type parsing error is shown if the user input adheres to the requirements of the used data type.) Default value is true.

methods.name: initBeforeOpen

parameters.name: bTypeahead
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether value help is opened for type-ahead or for complex help

methods.description: Calls initialization of the ValueHelp element before the value help is really opened. This is called in Typeahead on first letter before the value help is opened with a delay. So the content can be determined in the delegate coding early. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isFocusInHelp

returnValue.description: if true, focus goes to the value help, if false it stays in the calling control.

methods.description: Determines if the focus is set in the value help or stays in the calling control.

methods.name: isOpen

returnValue.description: true if open or opening

methods.description: Determines if the value help is open. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isTypeaheadSupported

returnValue.description: if true, the field help should open by typing. The result might be returned asynchronously, so a Promise is used.

methods.description: Determines if the value help should be opened when something is typed into the field. Opening the value help must be triggered by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: isValidationSupported

returnValue.description: True if value help can be used for input validation

methods.description: Defines if the value help can be used for input validation.

methods.name: navigate

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description: Triggers navigation in the value help. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: onControlChange
methods.description: Triggers some logic that must be executed in ValueHelp element if a Change event on the connected control is fired. This is done if the corresponding control value is changed (not during navigation). Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: open

parameters.name: bTypeahead
parameters.description: Flag that determines whether value help is opened for type-ahead or for complex help

methods.description: Opens the value help for the control to which the ValueHelp element is connected. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValueHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: removeFocus
methods.description: The focus visualization of the field help needs to be removed as the user starts typing into the field.

parameters.description: maximal conditions allowed (as ValueHelp might not be connected to a field)

methods.description: Returns the aria attributes the field needs from the value help

methods.name: getContent
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Content of the container. This aggregation holds the actual controls enabling the user to select items or create conditions (e.g. tables or condition panels)

methods.name: getItemForValue

returnValue.description: Promise returning object containing description, key, in and out parameters.

parameters.name: oConfig

parsedValue.name: parsedValue
parsedValue.description: Value parsed by type to fit the data type of the key

context.name: context
context.description: Contextual information provided by condition payload or inParameters/outParameters. This is only filled if the description needs to be determined for an existing condition.

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table the ValueHelp element might be connected to a different row.

checkKeyFirst.name: checkKeyFirst
checkKeyFirst.description: If set, the value help checks first if the value fits a key // TODO: not longer needed?

checkKey.name: checkKey
checkKey.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

checkDescription.name: checkDescription
checkDescription.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

conditionModelName.name: conditionModelName
conditionModelName.description: Name of the ConditionModel, in case of FilterField

caseSensitive.name: caseSensitive
caseSensitive.description: If set, the check is done case sensitive

parameters.description: Configuration

throws.description: if entry is not found or not unique

methods.description: Determines the item (key and description) for a given value. The container checks if there is an item with a key or description that fits this value. Note: This function must only be called by the ValueHelp element.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container.

methods.name: getTitle

returnValue.description: Value of property title

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTitle title}. Title text that appears in the dialog or tab header. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: getUseAsValueHelp

returnValue.description: True if value help shall open as valuehelp

methods.description: If the container is used for type-ahead it might be wanted that the same content should also be shown as valuehelp. If not, the field should not show a valuehelp icon. Note This function needs only to be implemented for Container implementing the sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.container.ITypeahead interface.

methods.name: getValueHelpDelegate

returnValue.description: Delegate module

throws.description: Throws an error if the delegate module is not available

methods.description: Determines the delegate of the value help Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: getValueHelpDelegatePayload

returnValue.description: payload

methods.description: Determines the delegate payload of the value help Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: getValueHelpIcon

returnValue.description: Name of the icon

methods.description: Return the value help icon that should be used for the field.

methods.name: indexOfContent

returnValue.description: The index of the provided control in the aggregation if found, or -1 otherwise

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content whose index is looked for

methods.description: Checks for the provided sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Content in the aggregation {@link #getContent content}. and returns its index if found or -1 otherwise.

methods.name: insertContent

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oContent
parameters.description: The content to insert; if empty, nothing is inserted

parameters.name: iIndex
parameters.description: The 0-based index the content should be inserted at; for a negative value of iIndex, the content is inserted at position 0; for a value greater than the current size of the aggregation, the content is inserted at the last position

methods.description: Inserts a content into the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

methods.name: isDialog

returnValue.description: True if used as dialog

methods.description: Determines if the container is used as dialog inside the value help The container is also used as dialog if useAsValueHelp is set on content and no other dialog is set. Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: isFocusInHelp

returnValue.description: if true, focus goes to the value help, if false it stays in the calling control.

methods.description: Determines if the focus is set in the value help or stays in the calling control.

methods.name: isMultiSelect

returnValue.description: if true, multi-selection is active.

methods.description: Determines if multiselection is active.

methods.name: isOpen

returnValue.description: true if open or opening

methods.description: Determines if the container is open. Note: This function must only be called by the ValueHelp element.

methods.name: isOpening

returnValue.description: true if opening

methods.description: Determines if the container is opening. Note: This function must only be called by the ValueHelp element.

methods.name: isTypeahead

returnValue.description: True if used as typeahead

methods.description: Determines if the container is used as typeahead inside the value help Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: isTypeaheadSupported

returnValue.description: Flag if searching is supported

methods.description: Determines if the content of the container supports typeahead Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: isValidationSupported

returnValue.description: True if content can be used for input validation

methods.description: Defines if the content of the container can be used for input validation.

methods.name: isValueHelpDelegateInitialized

returnValue.description: True if delegate is initialized

methods.description: Determines if delegate of the value help is initialized Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: navigate

returnValue.description: Promise returning object of navigated item (condition and itemId)

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description: Triggers navigation in the content of the container. As this could be asynchronous in case additional data needs to be loaded a promise is returned. Note: This function must only be called by the ValueHelp element.

methods.name: open

returnValue.description: This promise resolves after the container completely opened.

parameters.name: oValueHelpContentPromise
parameters.description: Promise for content request

methods.description: Opens the container

methods.name: providesScrolling

returnValue.description: True if scrolling is provided

methods.description: Determines if the container provides a own scroll functionality. If not, the Content needs to provide a scrolling solution like a {@link sap.m.ScrollContainer ScrollContainer}. Note: This function is used by the container and content and must not be used from outside

methods.name: removeAllContent

returnValue.description: An array of the removed elements (might be empty)

methods.description:
Removes all the controls from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

Additionally, it unregisters them from the hosting UIArea.

methods.name: removeContent

returnValue.description: The removed content or null

parameters.name: vContent
parameters.description: The content to remove or its index or id

methods.description: Removes a content from the aggregation {@link #getContent content}.

methods.name: removeFocus
methods.description: The focus visualization of the field help needs to be removed as the user starts typing into the field.

methods.name: setTitle

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sTitle
parameters.description: New value for property title

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getTitle title}. Title text that appears in the dialog or tab header. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is empty string.

methods.name: shouldOpenOnClick

returnValue.description: If true, the value help should open when user clicks into the connected field control

methods.description: Determines if the value help should be opened when the user clicks into the connected control.

returnValue.description: If true, the value help should open when user used the arrow keys in the connected field control

methods.description: Determines if the value help should be opened when the user used the arrow keys.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.FilterableListContent
symbols.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element.

properties.name: filterFields
properties.description: The fields based on which the table data is filtered. For filtering the value of the filterValue property is used. If set to $search and the used binding supports search requests, a $search request is used for filtering. If set to one or more properties, the filters for these properties are used for filtering. These filters are set on the ListBinding used. The properties need to be separated by commas and enclosed by "*" characters. ("*Property1,Property2*") If it is empty, no suggestion is available.

properties.name: keyPath
properties.description:
The path of the key field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the key of the items.

If not set, the FieldPath of the assigned field is used.

properties.name: descriptionPath
properties.description: The path of the description field in the content binding. If a table is used as content, this is the binding path of the description of the items.

properties.name: caseSensitive
properties.description: If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false.

properties.name: useFirstMatch
properties.description: If set, getKeyForText returns the first item that matches the text. This is the case if the text of the item starts with the text entered.

properties.name: useAsValueHelp
properties.description: If set, the List is also opened if the ValueHelp icon is pressed.

aggregations.description:
Sets the in parameters of a field help.

If set, the field help reads the data of these entities in the model and uses it to filter in the value help.

aggregations.name: outParameters
aggregations.description:
Sets the out parameters of a field help.

If set, the fields sets the data of these entities in the model based to the selected values.

methods.name: getCaseSensitive

returnValue.description: Value of property caseSensitive

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getCaseSensitive caseSensitive}. If this property is set to true, the filtering for user input is always case-sensitive. Otherwise user input is checked case-insensitively. If $search is used, this property has no effect on the $search request. If the used back-end service supports a case-insensitive search, set this property to false. Default value is false.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.FixedList
symbols.description: Content for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container Container} element showing a list with fix values.

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: If set, the items of the list can be grouped

properties.name: filterList
properties.description: If set, the items of the list are filtered based on filterValue. If a type-ahead behavior for the connected field is wanted, this property must be set to true. For small lists all values are meant to be shown, independent of the typing in the connected field. In this case this property must be set to false. If not set, the list opens if the user clicks into the connected field.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: Items of the field help. The key of the items is not shown in the list, but is used as a value of the connected field. If the additionalText for all the items is not used, the column will not be displayed. Note: At the moment, icons are not supported.

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getGroupConfig groupConfig}. Configuration for groups (collective search). When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is {}.

methods.name: getItemForValue

returnValue.description: Promise returning object containing description, key, in and out parameters.

parameters.name: oConfig

parsedValue.name: parsedValue
parsedValue.description: Value parsed by type to fit the data type of the key

inParameters.name: inParameters
inParameters.description: In parameters for the key (as a key must not be unique.)

outParameters.name: outParameters
outParameters.description: Out parameters for the key (as a key must not be unique.)

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of the checked field. Inside a table the ValueHelp element might be connected to a different row.

checkKeyFirst.name: checkKeyFirst
checkKeyFirst.description: If set, the value help checks first if the value fits a key // TODO: not longer needed?

checkKey.name: checkKey
checkKey.description: If set, the value help checks only if there is an item with the given key. This is set to false if the value cannot be a valid key because of type validation.

checkDescription.name: checkDescription
checkDescription.description: If set, the field help checks only if there is an item with the given description. This is set to false if only the key is used in the field.

conditionModelName.name: conditionModelName
conditionModelName.description: Name of the ConditionModel, in case of FilterField

parameters.description: Configuration

throws.description: if entry is not found or not unique

methods.description: Determines the item (key and description) for a given value. The value help checks if there is an item with a key or description that fits this value. Note: This function must only be called by the control the ValuedHelp element belongs to, not by the application.

methods.name: getUseAsValueHelp
methods.description: If the container is used for type-ahead it might be wanted that the same content should also be shown as valuehelp. If not, the field should not show a valuehelp icon.

methods.name: isValidationSupported

returnValue.description: True if the typeahead container can be used for input validation

methods.description: Defines if the typeahead can be used for input validation.

methods.name: navigate

returnValue.description: Promise returning object of navigated item (condition and itemId)

parameters.name: iStep
parameters.description: Number of steps for navigation (e.g. 1 means next item, -1 means previous item)

methods.description:
Navigates the typeaheads values (optional)

As this could be asyncronous as data might be loaded a promise is returned.

methods.name: open

returnValue.description: This promise resolves after the container completely opened.

methods.description: Opens the container

methods.name: removeFocus
methods.description: The focus visualization of the field help needs to be removed as the user starts typing into the source control.

methods.name: shouldOpenOnNavigate

returnValue.description: True if value help shall open as valuehelp

methods.description: Defines if the typeahead containers values can be navigated without visibly opening the help

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Popover
symbols.description: Container for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp} element showing a popover.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new Popover container. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container#constructor sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container} can be used.

methods.name: extend

returnValue.description: Created class / constructor function

parameters.name: sClassName
parameters.description: Name of the class being created

parameters.name: oClassInfo
parameters.description: Object literal with information about the class

parameters.name: FNMetaImpl
parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

methods.description: Creates a new subclass of class sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Popover with name sClassName and enriches it with the information contained in oClassInfo. oClassInfo might contain the same kind of information as described in {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.Container.extend}.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.Popover.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.ValueHelpItem
symbols.description:
Item object type.

If an item is requested using a description or key, an object with the following properties is returned.

properties.name: key
properties.description: Key of the item

properties.name: description
properties.description: Description of the item

properties.name: inParameters
properties.description: In parameters of the item. For each field path a value is stored

properties.name: outParameters
properties.description: Out parameters of the item. For each field path a value is stored
